content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quite easy but still fun, good puzzle.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and fun. I approve it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I agree on this problem as it fits well for new language learners.

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: it's verry easy to solve, there is no challenge. i solved it juste with .Replace with c# and it takes me less than 30 second.
great idea i liked it it was fun

1. Validators should be different than test cases. One simple way to create such validators would be to just swap the 1s and 0s.

2. Your Input section says the lists are first, but they are actually last.

3. Your Input sections uses the variable "m" for the number to multiply, but your stub generator uses "k".

4. Is there a good reason to wrap the lists in quotes and brackets in the input?

5. It's just my opinion, but I'd like to see a test case or two with a zoom factor other than 2 or 3.

6. Remove the "Line 1", "Line 2", "Line 3" text in the Goal section. Putting "Line 1" and "Line 2" in the output section means that all output is supposed to be exactly two lines, which of course is not the case.

Please refer to the contribution guidelines and fix your statement. Follow the example there.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

In addition:
Line 1, Line 2, etc should appear in the Input section.
Line 1, Line 2, etc should not appear in the Goal section.
Line 1, Line 2, etc should not appear in the Output section.
Tests and validators should be different.
Thanks for the feedback, all done !
Ok I changed what was wrong. But for the 4. I couldn't put lists and for the 5. I changed one but I can do more because the characters are limited in the output section and big number will not work.

For 4, you could just put:
0 1 0
1 1 1

or 
010
111

or 
0, 1, 0
1, 1, 1

I don't see why it needs "[ and ]"
In the Input section, suggest to replace "Line 4: row :" with "<<Next [[y]] lines:>>" instead.
